intro: Illecebrum tomentosum, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and trumpet-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing or trailing growth habit. Its stems are often covered in fine, white tomentum, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Illecebrum tomentosum is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun.
